p: T. lucida belongs to the Asteraceae family. It is an ancient medicinal species that, according to the literature and recent verbal reports of merchants and healers of Mexican regions, is used to treat several gastrointestinal affections involving colic and ulcer, as well as to alleviate musculoskeletal pain [ 6]. Because of the ethnobotanical reports for T. lucida, in this study, we explored the analgesic-like response using the formalin test in rats, a nociceptive pain model that allowed exploring central (neurogenic) and peripheral (inflammatory) nociception, as well as the writhing test in mice, which mimics abdominal pain.
